summary: The Veterans' Caregiver Appeals Modernization Act of 2025 aims to improve the Department of Veterans Affairs program providing comprehensive assistance for family caregivers. It mandates the development of a digital system for accessing applications and documents related to caregiver support, enhancing the efficiency of evaluating applications and appeals. Furthermore, it addresses training for VA employees handling appeals and considers lessons learned from other systems. It also includes provisions concerning the eligibility of family caregivers upon the death of the veteran.
